intro: Crossoglossa puipuiensis, commonly known as the Puipui bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or mountainous areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Crossoglossa puipuiensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique floral display.
